alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 20 at 2:53PM MST until May 20 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry in northern Coconino County, Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST /645 PM MDT/. * At 251 PM MST /351 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the Paria River watershed. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Buckskin Gulch, Paria Canyon, Lees Ferry, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. This includes the following slot canyons... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
